title: 2008/98/EC of 19 November 20085 hereby make the following regulations:
heading: 3. The following will be substituted for footnote 7 after Table 6 (Annual
text_raw:
3. The following will be substituted for footnote 7 after Table 6 (Annual 

nutrient excretion rates for livestock) in the 2022 Regulations: 

“From 2023 onwards the N excretion rate of the dairy cow will be 
determined by the average milk yield per annum for the three preceding 
years or the year preceding the implementation of the respective band as 
explained in footnote 8, 9 and 10. In addition, as a transitional measure 
applicable only in 2023, the band for 2023 may be determined by the 
herd’s average milk yield per cow using 2023 data.”
text_norm: 3 following substituted footnote 7 table 6 (annual nutrient excretion rate livestock) 2022 regulation 2023 onwards n excretion rate dairy cow determined average milk yield per annum three preceding year year preceding implementation respective band explained footnote 8 9 10 addition transitional measure applicable 2023 band 2023 may determined herd average milk yield per cow using 2023 data

title: 2008/98/EC of 19 November 20085 hereby make the following regulations:
heading: 4. The following will be substituted for Article 23 (5) in the 2022
text_raw:
4. The following will be substituted for Article 23 (5) in the 2022 

Regulations: 

“For the calculation of excretion rate bands: 

(a) An occupier of a holding shall maintain records of all milk 
deliveries to milk purchasers from that holding over the previous three 
calendar years, and shall, with effect from 1 January 2023, make 
available, on an annual basis, to the Minister for Agriculture, Food and 
the Marine, or any third party certified by the Minister for Agriculture, 
Food and the Marine such records in order to determine the excretion 
rates of dairy cows on the holding in accordance with Table 6 of 
Schedule 2. 

If the record of all milk delivered to milk purchaser on an annual 
(b) 
basis over the previous three calendar years from a holding is not 
submitted to the Minister, or a third party certified by the Minister, by 
28th February of any year, the designation of that occupier’s herd will be 
assigned, by default, to the highest excretion rate band as set out in Table 
6 of Schedule 2 for that year, or until the occupier submits information to 
the satisfaction of the Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine 
confirming a different excretion rate band as set out in Table 6 of 
Schedule 2 is appropriate for their herd.” 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 24th February, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [62] 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Housing, 
Local Government and Heritage, 

17 February, 2023. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [62] 5

title: 2008/98/EC of 19 November 20085 hereby make the following regulations:
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the European Union (Good Agricultural Practice for 
Protection of Waters) Regulations 2022. The purpose of the amendment is to 
give effect to an additional option for calculating the livestock excretion rate 
banding for 2023 only, and to change the deadline for provision of data to 
DAFM for calculating the banding from 14th February to the 28th February. 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [62]
